title: Implementation Strategies for Differentiated Instruction (DI) in Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Secondary Mathematics Concepts and Foundational Knowledge in Instructional Design
context.additional_context: A course simultaneously enhancing mathematical problem-solving skills and DI (Design Innovation) competencies in a mobile environment using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can apply the four key principles of DI (readiness, interest, learning profile, and differentiation) in actual cases within mathematics educational settings
Learners can analyze diagnostic assessment results to develop tiered differentiation strategies for content, process, and product
Learners can design DI lesson blueprints executable in mobile environments and establish comprehensive assessment systems
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
